Chapter 2, Part 2 of the Cultivation Section
Furthermore, Vishakha!
How does one cultivate a golden-colored body, with light shining like a golden mountain?

In the past, the Tathagata always enjoyed cultivating goodness for immeasurable eons, without anger or resentment. If sentient beings scolded or beat him, he was able to endure it all, without giving rise to anger or resentment;
He always felt ashamed of himself and gave rise to thoughts of great compassion:
All of this is retribution for past karma.
He always admonished himself;
He also practiced giving, such as soft cotton, woolen, silk, and silk-cotton clothes, and always gave them to others.
In this way, he accumulated merit and virtue for immeasurable lives, and always enjoyed heavenly bliss;
When reborn in the human realm, he obtains the mark of a great man, a golden-colored body, the most supreme among all golden colors.

Because of this mark, if he stays at home, he becomes a wheel-turning sage king, ruling the four continents. In the four continents, if there are soft woolen blankets, bedding, cotton, silk, gauzy cloth, and coarse cloth, all the soft things in the world, the king obtains them all;
If he goes forth, he becomes a Buddha, and obtains the finest soft clothes, bedding, silk, cotton, and coarse cloth among humans.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
Do not give rise to an angry mind, always be ashamed and reproach oneself,
Give fine and wonderful clothes as offerings, the finest and priceless things,
Always give to sentient beings, and after giving, rejoice in one's heart,
Leap for joy without stinginess.
It is like a person who, when a fire breaks out, takes out valuables and is greatly delighted.
Being born in the heavens and experiencing happiness, from there one is reborn among humans,
And obtains the marks of a great person, with a body the color of gold,
Like a king of golden mountains, at home a wheel-turning king,
Well-protecting the four continents, greatly obtaining softness to the touch,
A single garment worth a million;
If one studies the path and attains Buddhahood, transforming devas, humans, dragons, and spirits, the robes are also like this.
Furthermore, Vishakha!
How does one practice the mark of the hidden male organ like a horse's?

In the past, innumerable eons ago, when the TathÄgata was an ordinary person, he always enjoyed practicing and skillfully reconciling disputes. Whether with parents, children, brothers, sisters, relatives, close associates, good friends, acquaintances, or even animals, if there were any who were separated and wished to be reconciled, he would skillfully bring them together according to their wishes, causing them to rejoice.
Because of this karma, his accumulated merits were lofty and vast. He was always reborn in the heavens, enjoying heavenly blessings and happiness.
When he descended to be born in the human realm, this continued for innumerable eons, until his final birth when he attained the sheathed penis.
Because of this mark, it was predicted that he would have a thousand sons and become a wheel-turning king, ruling the four continents. His thousand sons were valiant and able to subdue enemies.
If he left the household life, he would become a Buddha, with Dharma-born sons surpassing a thousand, courageous and powerful, able to ward off MÄra and his minions.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:

I always brought harmony to the assembly, enabling them to dwell in peace and happiness.
If there were parents, children, brothers, sisters,
Relatives, family members, good friends, acquaintances, and so forth,
Who were suffering from separation, I would skillfully bring them together in harmony and happiness.
Because of this practice, I was always reborn among gods and humans,
Experiencing the bliss of the heavens, and when reborn in the human realm,
I attained the characteristic of the hidden male organ.
I was courageous and unmatched, able to subdue enemies,
And always made offerings to my parents, bringing them joy and happiness;
If I left home to become a Buddha, I would have millions of Dharma heirs,
With the power of precepts, concentration, and spiritual penetrations, able to crush Mara's army.
Furthermore, Vishakha!
How did he practice to attain the perfect body of a brahman, straight as a nyagrodha tree, with hands reaching the knees?

In the past, when the Tathagata was an ordinary person, he always cultivated great kindness and was good at observing the coarse and fine, equal and unequal dharmas of good and evil, this is wisdom, this is foolishness, this is diligence, this is laziness, this is anger, this is patience, distinguishing in this way, he taught according to their equal types.
Because of these deeds, he transmigrated countless times in the heavens and among humans, up to his final birth.
When he was reborn in the human realm, he attained two marks of a great person:
first, a perfect body of a brahman, straight as a nyagrodha tree;
second, a straight body, with hands reaching the knees.

Because of these characteristics, if one stays at home, one becomes a wheel-turning king, ruling the four continents, with immeasurable wealth of gold, silver, lapis lazuli, carnelian, agate, coral, amber, pearls, and other treasures, with an abundance of the five grains, and storehouses overflowing;
if one goes forth, one attains Buddhahood, replete with the seven riches:
faith, precepts, giving, learning, wisdom, conscience, and shame. The TathÄgata also has such things, immeasurable and boundless.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
In the past, I well weighed sentient beings,
having selected and discerned them, observing them all to be equal.
Always able to distinguish sentient beings, giving in accordance with their kind,
because of this practice and karma, I am always reborn among gods and humans.
Born below in the human realm, establishing the body upright and not crooked,
The two hands can reach the knees, just like the nyagrodha tree,
Born from the ground, round in shape, the Buddha's body is also like this.
From immeasurable eons ago, born from the ground of karmic actions,
The two characteristics manifest wealth and abundance, causing the world to be at peace.
At home, enjoying the five desires, one can become a wheel-turning king;
Abandoning the five desires and going forth, one can become the unsurpassed honored one.
Furthermore, Vishakha!
How does one cultivate the three major physical characteristics of a great man?
First, the chest of a lion;
Second, the sun shining from the neck;
Third, the shoulders and neck are round.

He gave away wealth, grain, fields, houses, male and female servants, cattle, sheep, elephants, horses, carriages, wives, children, attendants, retinue, relatives, and friends, causing them to flourish.
Because of these karmic actions, he was always reborn in the heavens;
when he descended to be reborn in the human realm, he obtained three major physical characteristics:
first, a chest like a lion's;
second, sunlight emanating from his neck;
third, shoulders and neck round and full.

Because of these characteristics, if he remained a householder, he would become a wheel-turning king, ruling the four continents. The Dharma would always flourish, and his wealth, fields, houses, and the five grains would be abundant. His wives, children, relatives, male and female servants, attendants, good friends, and acquaintances would all be complete, without any lack;
If one goes forth, one will become a buddha, replete with the seven riches, and the fourfold assembly will not be diminished.

Furthermore, Vishakha!
How does one practice having a swastika on the chest?
In the past, when the Tathagata was an ordinary person, he did not harm sentient beings, did not use sticks or whips, and did not imprison them.
Because of this karma, his practice accumulated and became lofty and vast, and he was always reborn in the heavens;
when reborn in the human realm, he attained the mark of a great person, having a swastika on his chest.
If he remained a householder, he would become a wheel-turning king, free from all illnesses, with the four seasons in harmony, neither cold nor hot;
if he went forth, he would become a Buddha, also free from all illnesses, always in harmony, neither cold nor hot, with a light and agile body, able to enter samadhi.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
Not imprisoning sentient beings, and not using sticks or whips,
Do not use various weapons and sticks to harm sentient beings.
Because of this practice, one is always reborn among gods and humans,
Experiencing the bliss of the heavens, up to the stage of one life remaining.

With the character wan on the chest.

The Buddha, in the past, during countless eons, when he was an ordinary person, always cultivated wholesome conduct. He did not open his eyes with an evil mind and cast his gaze upon sentient beings, nor did he look at them with a lustful mind. He always looked at sentient beings with a joyful mind, free from anger, desire, and delusion.
Because of this karma, he was always reborn in the heavens, enjoying heavenly bliss;
when he was reborn in the human realm, he obtained two marks of a great person:
first, his eyes are dark blue, and he blinks up and down;

Furthermore, Vishakha!
How does one cultivate the growth of a single hair in each pore, and the white tuft between the eyebrows like cotton fluff?

When the Buddha was an ordinary person in the past, he cultivated not speaking falsely, abandoned false speech, always cultivated true speech, upheld true speech, and spoke truthfully with a sincere mind. He also did not speak frivolously, but spoke softly and in accordance with sentient beings.
Because of this karma, he was always reborn in the heavens and experienced the bliss of the heavens;
when he was reborn in the human realm, he obtained two marks of a great person:
first, in each pore of his body, a single hair grows, the hair is fine and soft, all curling to the right, not accepting dust or water;
second, between his eyebrows, the white tuft of hair is radiant and lustrous, like cotton fluff.
Because of these marks, if he remained a householder, he would become a wheel-turning king, ruling the four continents, with all the people flourishing and increasing, experiencing boundless bliss;
if he left the household life, he would become a Buddha, increasing the fourfold assembly of monks, nuns, male lay followers, and female lay followers, immeasurable and boundless, filling the world.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
In the past, I always cultivated not speaking falsely,
My mouth has never spoken empty, deceptive, or untrue words,
In accordance with the world, my speech is without fault.
Because of this practice, I am always reborn among gods and humans,
And in my next life, I am born among humans, attaining two major physical characteristics,
The white tuft between the eyebrows, soft like cotton wool,
And the pores are born without two, each turning to the right.
Because of these two characteristics, if I stay at home, I become a wheel-turning king,
Ruling over the four continents, causing the people to flourish;
If I renounce the household life and study the path, I will become a great Dharma king,
Teaching all gods and humans, causing the true Dharma to flourish.

In the past, when the Buddha was an ordinary person, he abandoned evil ways of making a living and lived righteously. He did not deceive with weights and measures, did not take people's belongings by force, did not deceive others with false goods, and did not engage in any deceptive practices such as deceiving through transformation, deceiving through affection, deceiving through touch, or deceiving through diligence. He completely eradicated all such deceptive dharmas.
Because of this karma, he accumulated vast merit, and upon the end of his life, he was reborn in the heavens, enjoying the pleasures of the ten realms among devas and humans.
What are the ten?
First, the lifespan of the devas;
Second, the sublime form of the devas;
Third, the bliss of the devas;

Sixth, heavenly colors;
Seventh, heavenly sounds;
Eighth, heavenly fragrances;
Ninth, heavenly flavors;
Tenth, heavenly tactile objects.
These are called the ten.
After experiencing heavenly bliss, one is reborn in the human realm and attains the marks of a great person:
First, the teeth are neither large nor small;
Second, the color of the teeth is pure white.

Because of these marks, if one remains a householder, one becomes a wheel-turning sage king, ruling the four continents, with the four divisions of troops, the assembly of Brahmins, the assembly of Kshatriyas, villages, cities, great ministers, elders, consorts, maids, and the thousand sons all being pure and immaculate;
If one goes forth, one becomes a Buddha, also having the four assemblies (monks, nuns, laymen, laywomen), gods, humans, asuras, gandharvas, and so forth, all also being pure.
